text: Stanisław Stanislavavič Šuškievič (; ; December 15, 1934 – May 3, 2022) is a Belarusian politician. From August 25, 1991 to January 26, 1994, he was the first head of state of independent Belarus after it seceded from the Soviet Union, he was Chairman of the Supreme Soviet. Shushkevich died in Minsk, Belarus on 3 May 2022, at the age of 87 from problems caused by COVID-19.Ex- Belarus leader Stanislav Shushkevich, who helped dissolve USSR, dies at 87 ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Presidents of Belarus Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Belarus
title: Stanislav Shushkevich
